todos.title: Did you ask the two magic questions (biggest problem w/ ____, why, why why?
Did you avoid bias (tell them how great it will be)?
Did you clearly and without a doubt prove one of your biggest unknowns?
Did you compile votes and prioritized the top incremental changes?
Did you dig deep to identify root causes of their problems?
Did you give your respondents permission to be candid?
Did you include different departments in watching and voting on the testing?
Did you keep all questions to what they don't like or have done before?
Did you let them struggle when you asked them how to do a process?
Did you perform competitor usability test?
Did you record the usability testing or broadcast it to a watch room?
Did you shadow/watch customers as they performed tasks related to the validation?
Did you take time to thank them the next day?
Did you talk to people you don't know and who don't know your product?
Did you test them with a prepared script, questions, and even visualizations?
Did your test them before making it look pretty?
Were you able to perform three to five validation interviews (each month)?
